hwIpdslamSimulation.name: hwIpdslamSimulation
hwIpdslamSimulation.contactinfo: Huawei Industrial Base Bantian, Longgang Shenzhen 518129 People's Republic of China Website: http://www.huawei.com Email: support@huawei.com
hwIpdslamSimulation.description: The MIB is used to configure the simulation for the DSLAM.

hwDhcpSimulateCfgTable.name: hwDhcpSimulateCfgTable
hwDhcpSimulateCfgTable.description: This table is mainly used to configure the DHCP simulation. You can use the set operation to set a leave in the table to start a DHCP simulation instance and simulate an actual user. You can use the get operation to query the existing DHCP simulation instances in the current system. The indexes of this table are hwDhcpSimulateFlowId and hwDhcpSimulateMacAddress.

hwDhcpSimulateCfgEntry.name: hwDhcpSimulateCfgEntry
hwDhcpSimulateCfgEntry.description: This table is mainly used to configure the DHCP simulation. You can use the set operation to set a leave in the table to start a DHCP simulation instance and simulate an actual user. You can use the get operation to query the existing DHCP simulation instances in the current system. The indexes of this entry are hwDhcpSimulateFlowId and hwDhcpSimulateMacAddress.

hwDhcpSimulateFlowId.name: hwDhcpSimulateFlowId
hwDhcpSimulateFlowId.description: Indicates the flow ID of the user to be simulated. This leave is the index of hwDhcpSimulateCfgTable. The value of this leave must be set when a DHCP simulation is started on the OLT.

hwDhcpSimulateMacAddress.name: hwDhcpSimulateMacAddress
hwDhcpSimulateMacAddress.description: Indicates the MAC address of the user to be simulated. In the start of DHCP simulation, the recommended MAC address corresponding this leave is the MAC address of an actual user. This leave is the index of hwDhcpSimulateCfgTable. The value of this leave must be set when a DHCP simulation is started on the OLT.

hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber.name: hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber
hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber.description: Indicates the number of tags carried by the user-side packet. Options: 1. untag(0) -Indicates that the user packet is untagged. 2. singleTag(1) -Indicates that the user packet is single tag.

hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanid.name: hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanid
hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanid.description: Indicates the VLAN ID of the user-side packet. If hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber is 0, this item does not need to be configured. If the value of this leave is 0 and hwDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber is 1, the current mode is priority-tag. Range: 0-4095.

hwDhcpSimulateOption60.name: hwDhcpSimulateOption60
hwDhcpSimulateOption60.description: Indicates the option 60 contents of the DHCP simulation instance. The length is 0-64 bytes. The system considers that this leave is not configured when the length is 0.

hwDhcpSimulateOption61Type.name: hwDhcpSimulateOption61Type
hwDhcpSimulateOption61Type.description: Indicates the option 61 type of the DHCP simulation instance. The values are 0 and 1. Options: 1. string(0) -Indicates that the option 61 contents are a string. 2. mac(1) -Indicates that the option 61 contents are a hardware address.

hwDhcpSimulateOption61ClientId.name: hwDhcpSimulateOption61ClientId
hwDhcpSimulateOption61ClientId.description: Indicates the option 61 contents of the DHCP simulation instance. The length is 0-64 bytes.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1IPAddress.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1IPAddress
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1IPAddress.description: Indicates the first host IP address to be pinged in the DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2IPAddress.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2IPAddress
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2IPAddress.description: Indicates the second host IP address to be pinged in the DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3IPAddress.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3IPAddress
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3IPAddress.description: Indicates the third host IP address to be pinged in the DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4IPAddress.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4IPAddress
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4IPAddress.description: Indicates the fourth host IP address to be pinged in the DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5IPAddress.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5IPAddress
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5IPAddress.description: Indicates the fifth host IP address to be pinged in the DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwDhcpSimulateRowStatus.name: hwDhcpSimulateRowStatus
hwDhcpSimulateRowStatus.description: Indicates the operation type and is mainly used to start or stop the DHCP simulation. During query, if the corresponding simulation instance exists, the result is active. Options: 1. active(1) -indicates the query operation. 2. createAndGo(4) -means to create a DHCP simulation. 3. destroy(6) -means to stop a DHCP simulation.

hwDhcpSimulateResultTable.name: hwDhcpSimulateResultTable
hwDhcpSimulateResultTable.description: Indicates the simulation result. During simulation, you can perform the get operation to query the simulation result of the simulation instance. The indexes of this table are hwDhcpSimulateFlowId and hwDhcpSimulateMacAddress.

hwDhcpSimulateResultEntry.name: hwDhcpSimulateResultEntry
hwDhcpSimulateResultEntry.description: Indicates the simulation result. During simulation, you can perform the get operation to query the simulation result of the simulation instance. The indexes of this entry are hwDhcpSimulateFlowId and hwDhcpSimulateMacAddress.

hwDhcpSimulateStatus.name: hwDhcpSimulateStatus
hwDhcpSimulateStatus.description: Indicates the simulation status of the current simulation instance. Options: 1. dhcpProcessing(1) -indicates DHCP processing. 2. pingProcessing(2) -indicates ping processing. 3. finished(3) -Indicates that the simulation is finished. 4. unknown(4) -indicates other status.

hwDhcpSimulateResult.name: hwDhcpSimulateResult
hwDhcpSimulateResult.description: Indicates the simulation result of the current simulation instance. Options: 1. sendPacketFail(1) -Indicates that the packet fails to be sent. 2. dhcpServerNotFound(2) -Indicates that the DHCP server cannot be found. 3. dhcpServerRejectRequest(3) -Indicates that the DHCP server rejects the request. 4. getIpOvertime(4) -Indicates that the request for IP address is overtime. 5. getIpSuccessful(5) -Indicates that the request for IP address succeeds. 6. allPingSucceed(6) -Indicates that all ping operations succeed. 7. partialPingSucceed(7) -Indicates that parts of ping operations succeed. 8. allPingFail(8) -Indicates that all ping operations fail. 9. systemResourceNotEnough(9) -Indicates that the resource is not enough. 10. unknown(10) -Indicates other results.

hwDhcpSimulateUserIp.name: hwDhcpSimulateUserIp
hwDhcpSimulateUserIp.description: Indicates the simulation user IP address that is obtained in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateSubNetMask.name: hwDhcpSimulateSubNetMask
hwDhcpSimulateSubNetMask.description: Indicates the mask of the simulation user IP address that is obtained in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDhcpServerIp.name: hwDhcpSimulateDhcpServerIp
hwDhcpSimulateDhcpServerIp.description: Indicates the DHCP server IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePrimaryDnsServerIp.name: hwDhcpSimulatePrimaryDnsServerIp
hwDhcpSimulatePrimaryDnsServerIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the primary DNS server in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateSecondaryDnsServerIp.name: hwDhcpSimulateSecondaryDnsServerIp
hwDhcpSimulateSecondaryDnsServerIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the secondary DNS server in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateGatewayIp.name: hwDhcpSimulateGatewayIp
hwDhcpSimulateGatewayIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the gateway in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDefaultGatewayIp.name: hwDhcpSimulateDefaultGatewayIp
hwDhcpSimulateDefaultGatewayIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the default gateway in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest1IpAddr.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest1IpAddr
hwDhcpSimulateDest1IpAddr.description: Indicates the destination IP address of the first route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest1MaskAddr.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest1MaskAddr
hwDhcpSimulateDest1MaskAddr.description: Indicates the mask corresponding to the destination IP address of the first route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest1NextHop.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest1NextHop
hwDhcpSimulateDest1NextHop.description: Indicates the next hop IP address of the first route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest2IpAddr.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest2IpAddr
hwDhcpSimulateDest2IpAddr.description: Indicates the destination IP address of the second route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest2MaskAddr.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest2MaskAddr
hwDhcpSimulateDest2MaskAddr.description: Indicates the mask corresponding to the destination IP address of the second route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest2NextHop.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest2NextHop
hwDhcpSimulateDest2NextHop.description: Indicates the next hop IP address of the second route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest3IpAddr.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest3IpAddr
hwDhcpSimulateDest3IpAddr.description: Indicates the destination IP address of the third route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest3MaskAddr.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest3MaskAddr
hwDhcpSimulateDest3MaskAddr.description: Indicates the mask corresponding to the destination IP address of the third route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateDest3NextHop.name: hwDhcpSimulateDest3NextHop
hwDhcpSimulateDest3NextHop.description: Indicates the next hop IP address of the third route in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1TotalCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1TotalCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the first host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1OkCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1OkCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost1OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the first host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2TotalCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2TotalCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the second host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2OkCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2OkCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost2OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the second host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3TotalCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3TotalCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the third host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3OkCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3OkCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost3OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the third host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4TotalCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4TotalCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the fourth host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4OkCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4OkCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost4OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the fourth host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5TotalCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5TotalCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the fifth host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5OkCount.name: hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5OkCount
hwDhcpSimulatePingHost5OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the fifth host IP address in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateTftpServer.name: hwDhcpSimulateTftpServer
hwDhcpSimulateTftpServer.description: Indicates the name of the Tftp server in the DHCP simulation instance. The length is 0-256 bytes.

hwDhcpSimulateBootFileName.name: hwDhcpSimulateBootFileName
hwDhcpSimulateBootFileName.description: Indicates the name of the boot file in the DHCP simulation instance. The length is 0-256 bytes.

hwDhcpSimulateTimeServerIp.name: hwDhcpSimulateTimeServerIp
hwDhcpSimulateTimeServerIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the time server in the DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateCfgTable.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateCfgTable
hwOntDhcpSimulateCfgTable.description: This table is mainly used to configure the ONT DHCP simulation. You can use the set operation to set a leave in the table to start an ONT DHCP simulation instance and simulate an actual user. You can use the get operation to query the existing ONT DHCP simulation instances in the current system. The indexes of this table are hwOntDhcpSimulatePortindex and hwOntDhcpSimulateOntId.

hwOntDhcpSimulateCfgEntry.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateCfgEntry
hwOntDhcpSimulateCfgEntry.description: This table is mainly used to configure the ONT DHCP simulation. You can use the set operation to set a leave in the table to start an ONT DHCP simulation instance and simulate an actual user. You can use the get operation to query the existing ONT DHCP simulation instances in the current system. The indexes of this entry are hwOntDhcpSimulatePortindex and hwOntDhcpSimulateOntId.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePortindex.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePortindex
hwOntDhcpSimulatePortindex.description: Indicates the ptp index corresponding to the user to be simulated in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateOntId.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateOntId
hwOntDhcpSimulateOntId.description: Indicates the ONT ID of the user to be simulated in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateOntPortId.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateOntPortId
hwOntDhcpSimulateOntPortId.description: Indicates the ONT port ID. The values are 1-8 and all-Fs. All-Fs indicates that the port is a WAN port and non-all Fs indicates that the port is a user-side port.

hwOntDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber
hwOntDhcpSimulateUserVlanTagNumber.description: Indicates the number of VLAN tags when user packets are sent to the ONT. Range: 0-2. 0 - untag. 1 - simgle tag. 2 - double tag.

hwOntDhcpSimulateUserOuterVlanId.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateUserOuterVlanId
hwOntDhcpSimulateUserOuterVlanId.description: Indicates the outer VLAN ID of user packets and is used with TagNumber. This parameter can be ignored in the case of untag. It is valid in the case of single-tag or double-tag, and the range is 0-4095. All-Fs indicates invalid and no user input. Range: 0-4095. This leave is used when the number of VLAN tags is 1 or 2.

hwOntDhcpSimulateUserOuterPriority.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateUserOuterPriority
hwOntDhcpSimulateUserOuterPriority.description: Indicates the outer VLAN priority of user packets and is used with TagNumber. This parameter can be ignored in the case of untag. It is valid in the case of single-tag or double-tag, and the range is 0-7. All-Fs indicates invalid and no user input. The default value is 0 in the case of no user input. Range: 0-7.

hwOntDhcpSimulateUserInnerVlanId.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateUserInnerVlanId
hwOntDhcpSimulateUserInnerVlanId.description: Indicates the inner VLAN ID of user packets and is used with TagNumber. This parameter is valid in the case of double-tag, and the range is 0-4095. All-Fs indicates invalid and no user input. Range: 0-4095.

hwOntDhcpSimulateUserInnerPriority.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateUserInnerPriority
hwOntDhcpSimulateUserInnerPriority.description: Indicates the inner VLAN priority of user packets and is used with TagNumber. This parameter is valid in the case of double-tag, and the range is 0-7. All-Fs indicates invalid and no user input. The default value is 0 in the case of no user input.

hwOntDhcpSimulateMacAddress.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateMacAddress
hwOntDhcpSimulateMacAddress.description: Indicates the source MAC address used in the simulation.

hwOntDhcpSimulateOption60.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateOption60
hwOntDhcpSimulateOption60.description: Indicates the option 60 contents of the ONT DHCP simulation. Character string type, a string of 0-64 characters.

hwOntDhcpSimulateOption61Type.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateOption61Type
hwOntDhcpSimulateOption61Type.description: Indicates the option 61 type of the ONT DHCP simulation. Values: 0-1. 0 indicates character string type and 1 indicate MAC address type. Options: 1. string(0) -Indicates that the option 61 contents are a string. 2. mac(1) -Indicates that the option 61 contents are a hardware address.

hwOntDhcpSimulateOption61ClientId.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateOption61ClientId
hwOntDhcpSimulateOption61ClientId.description: Indicates the option 61 contents of the ONT DHCP simulation. Character string type, a string of 0-64 characters. Optiontype = 0 and null in this field indicate no user input for option 61.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1IPAddress.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1IPAddress
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1IPAddress.description: Indicates the first host IP address to be pinged in the ONT DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2IPAddress.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2IPAddress
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2IPAddress.description: Indicates the second host IP address to be pinged in the ONT DHCP simulation. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3IPAddress.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3IPAddress
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3IPAddress.description: Indicates the third host IP address to be pinged in the ONT DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4IPAddress.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4IPAddress
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4IPAddress.description: Indicates the fourth host IP address to be pinged in the ONT DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5IPAddress.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5IPAddress
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5IPAddress.description: Indicates the fifth host IP address to be pinged in the ONT DHCP simulation instance. After an IP address is requested successfully in the DHCP simulation instance, this IP address is pinged to verify the connectivity to the host.

hwOntDhcpSimulateRowStatus.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateRowStatus
hwOntDhcpSimulateRowStatus.description: Indicates the operation type and is mainly used to start or stop the ONT DHCP simulation. During query, if the corresponding simulation instance exists, the result is active. Options: 1. active(1) -indicates the query operation. 2. createAndGo(4) -means to create a DHCP simulation. 3. destroy(6) -means to stop a DHCP simulation.

hwOntDhcpSimulateResultTable.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateResultTable
hwOntDhcpSimulateResultTable.description: Indicates the ONT simulation result. During simulation, you can perform the get operation to query the simulation result of the simulation instance. The indexes of this table are hwOntDhcpSimulatePortindex and hwOntDhcpSimulateOntId.

hwOntDhcpSimulateResultEntry.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateResultEntry
hwOntDhcpSimulateResultEntry.description: Indicates the ONT simulation result. During simulation, you can perform the get operation to query the simulation result of the simulation instance. The indexes of this entry are hwOntDhcpSimulatePortindex and hwOntDhcpSimulateOntId.

hwOntDhcpSimulateStatus.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateStatus
hwOntDhcpSimulateStatus.description: Indicates the simulation status of the current simulation instance. Options: 1. dhcpProcessing(1) -Indicates DHCP processing. 2. pingProcessing(2) -Indicates ping processing. 3. finished(3) -Indicates that the simulation is finished. 4. unknown(4) -Indicates other status.

hwOntDhcpSimulateResult.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateResult
hwOntDhcpSimulateResult.description: Indicates the simulation result of the current simulation instance. Options: 1. success(1) -Indicates that ont dhcp simulation succeeds. 2. userStop(2) -Indicates that user stopped the ont simulation. 3. deviceNotSupport(3) -Indicates that the device does not support simulation. 4. ethPortNotFound(4) -Indicates that eth port is not found. 5. userMacError(5) -Indicates that user mac is invalid. 6. pingDestIpError(6) -Indicates that the destination ip(s) for ping is(are) invalid. 7. vlanPriParaError(7) -Indicates that the VLAN or priority parameters are invalid. 8. dhcpOptionError(8) -Indicates that dhcp options have some errors. 9. wanNotFound(9) -Indicates that WAN port is not found. 10. wanStateError(10) -Indicates that WAN port is in error state. 11. ethPortStateError(11) -Indicates that eth port is in error state. 12. userVlanError(12) -Indicates that user vlan has some error. 13. devResourceNotEnough(13) -Indicates that the resource for the device is not enough. 14. gemportError(14) -Indicates that gemport has some error. 15. sendPktError(15) -Indicates that the packet fails to be sent. 16. dhcpServerNotFound(16) -Indicates that the DHCP server cannot be found. 17. dhcpServerDeny(17) -Indicates that the DHCP server rejects the request. 18. getIpTimeout(18) -Indicates that the request for IP address is overtime. 19. concurrentSmltForbidden(19) -Indicates that the specified ont does not support concurrent simulations. 20. allPingFail(20) -Indicates that all ping operations fail. 21. partialPingFail(21) -Indicates that that parts of ping operations fail. 22. unknown(22) -Indicates that the result is unknown.

hwOntDhcpSimulateUserIp.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateUserIp
hwOntDhcpSimulateUserIp.description: Indicates the simulation user IP address that is obtained in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateSubNetMask.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateSubNetMask
hwOntDhcpSimulateSubNetMask.description: Indicates the mask of the simulation user IP address that is obtained in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDhcpServerIp.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDhcpServerIp
hwOntDhcpSimulateDhcpServerIp.description: Indicates the DHCP server IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePrimaryDnsServerIp.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePrimaryDnsServerIp
hwOntDhcpSimulatePrimaryDnsServerIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the primary DNS server in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateSecondaryDnsServerIp.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateSecondaryDnsServerIp
hwOntDhcpSimulateSecondaryDnsServerIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the secondary DNS server in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateGatewayIp.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateGatewayIp
hwOntDhcpSimulateGatewayIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the gateway in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDefaultGatewayIp.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDefaultGatewayIp
hwOntDhcpSimulateDefaultGatewayIp.description: Indicates the IP address of the default gateway in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1IpAddr.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1IpAddr
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1IpAddr.description: Indicates the destination IP address of the first route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1MaskAddr.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1MaskAddr
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1MaskAddr.description: Indicates the mask corresponding to the destination IP address of the first route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1NextHop.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1NextHop
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest1NextHop.description: Indicates the next hop IP address of the first route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2IpAddr.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2IpAddr
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2IpAddr.description: Indicates the destination IP address of the second route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2MaskAddr.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2MaskAddr
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2MaskAddr.description: Indicates the mask corresponding to the destination IP address of the second route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2NextHop.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2NextHop
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest2NextHop.description: Indicates the next hop IP address of the second route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3IpAddr.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3IpAddr
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3IpAddr.description: Indicates the destination IP address of the third route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3MaskAddr.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3MaskAddr
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3MaskAddr.description: Indicates the mask corresponding to the destination IP address of the third route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3NextHop.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3NextHop
hwOntDhcpSimulateDest3NextHop.description: Indicates the next hop IP address of the third route in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1TotalCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1TotalCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the first host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1OkCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1OkCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost1OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the first host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2TotalCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2TotalCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the second host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2OkCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2OkCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost2OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the second host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3TotalCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3TotalCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the third host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3OkCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3OkCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost3OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the third host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4TotalCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4TotalCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the fourth host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4OkCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4OkCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost4OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the fourth host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5TotalCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5TotalCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5TotalCount.description: Indicates the total times of pinging the fifth host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5OkCount.name: hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5OkCount
hwOntDhcpSimulatePingHost5OkCount.description: Indicates the times of successfully pinging the fifth host IP address in the ONT DHCP simulation instance.

hwDhcpSimulateExtStatusTrap.name: hwDhcpSimulateExtStatusTrap
hwDhcpSimulateExtStatusTrap.description: This item is mainly used to notify the gateway of the simulation status and result when the simulation is finished. It mainly includes four items: flow ID, MAC address, simulation status, and simulation result.

hwOntDhcpSimulateExtStatusTrap.name: hwOntDhcpSimulateExtStatusTrap
hwOntDhcpSimulateExtStatusTrap.description: This item is mainly used to notify the gateway of the simulation status and result when the simulation is finished. It mainly includes four items: port ID, ONT ID, simulation status, and simulation result.
